Skip to main content
Ctrl+K
This is a community-supported SSVEP measure and aperiod analysis for EEG or other time series signal. If you'd like to contribute, check out our GitHub repository. Your contributions are welcome!

Class for Canonical Correlation Analysis (CCA) methods.

Package Contents#

class scut_ssvep_aperiod.ssvep_method.CCABase(sfreq, ws, fres_list, n_harmonics)[source]#

Bases: SSVEPMethodBase

Class for Canonical Correlation Analysis (CCA) methods.

Inherits from SSVEPMethodBase and adds harmonic analysis capabilities.

n_harmonics#

Number of harmonics to consider for reference signals.

Type:

int

find_correlation(n_components, X, Y)[source]#

Finds the maximum correlation between data and reference signals.

Parameters:

  • n_components (int) – Number of components for CCA.

  • X (np.ndarray) – Data matrix (trials x features).

  • Y (np.ndarray) – Reference signals (frequencies x time).

Returns:

Maximum correlation values for each frequency.

Return type:

np.ndarray

get_reference_signal()[source]#

Generates reference signals for each frequency and harmonic.

Returns:

An array of reference signals shaped as (n_events, n_harmonics * 2, T).

Return type:

np.ndarray

_cca_classify(test_data, ica_=False)[source]#

Classifies the test data using CCA.

Parameters:

  • test_data (ndarray) – shape(n_channels,n_times)

  • ica (bool) – Whether to apply ICA.

Returns:

The index of the class with the highest correlation.

Return type:

int

_cca_ex(test_data, ica_=False)[source]#

Performs Canonical Correlation Analysis (CCA) on the provided test data.

Parameters:

  • test_data (ndarray) – Input data with shape (n_channels, n_times).

  • ica (bool) – Flag indicating whether to apply Independent Component Analysis (ICA).

Returns:

The correlation results obtained from the CCA.

Return type:

ndarray

calculate_ex(test_data, ica_=False)[source]#

Calculates the CCA results for each sample in the test data.

Parameters:

  • test_data (ndarray) – shape(n_epochs,n_channels,n_times)

  • ica (bool) – Whether to apply ICA.

Returns:

An array of CCA results for each sample.

Return type:

ndarray

classify(test_data, ica_=False)[source]#

Classifies the provided test data using Canonical Correlation Analysis (CCA).

Parameters:

  • test_data (ndarray) – Input data with shape (n_channels, n_times).

  • ica (bool) – Flag indicating whether to apply ICA.

Returns:

The index of the class with the highest correlation result.

Return type:

int

class scut_ssvep_aperiod.ssvep_method.PSDA(sfreq, ws, fres_list, n_harmonics, psd_type='Ordinary', psd_channel='ave', psda_type='direct_compare', freq_range=None, figure_=False, save_path_base=['__', '__'])[source]#

Bases: scut_ssvep_aperiod.ssvep_method.ssvep_methd_base.SSVEPMethodBase

Class for Power Spectral Density Analysis (PSDA) of SSVEP data.

Parameters:

  • sfreq (float) – Sampling frequency of the data.

  • ws (float) – Window size for analysis.

  • fres_list (list) – List of frequencies of interest.

  • n_harmonics (int) – Number of harmonics to consider.

  • psd_type (str) – Type of PSD calculation (default is “Ordinary”).

  • psd_channel (str) – Channel type for PSD calculation (default is “ave”).

  • psda_type (str) – Type of PSDA method to use (default is “direct_compare”).

  • freq_range (tuple, optional) – Frequency range for analysis.

  • figure (bool) – Whether to generate figures (default is False).

  • save_path_base (list) – Base path for saving figures (default is [“__”, “__”]).

calculate_snr(data)[source]#

Calculates the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) for each trial.

Parameters:

data (numpy.ndarray) – Input data for SNR calculation.

Returns:

SNR values for each frequency for all trials.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

classify(data)[source]#

Classifies the input data using PSDA.

Parameters:

data (numpy.ndarray) – Input data for classification.

Returns:

Predicted labels, errors, and R-squared values for each trial.

Return type:

tuple

slope_estimation(data)[source]#

Estimates the slope of the PSD for each trial.

Parameters:

data (numpy.ndarray) – Input data for slope estimation.

Returns:

Errors and R-squared values for each trial.

Return type:

tuple

Train the TDCA model on input EEG signals and labels.

Parameters:

  • y (ndarray) – Input labels (n_trials,).

Returns:

TDCA object.

Return type:

self

  • fb_i (int) – Filter bank index.

Returns:

class scut_ssvep_aperiod.ssvep_method.TRCA(sfreq, ws, fres_list, n_harmonics, filter_=None)[source]#

Bases: scut_ssvep_aperiod.ssvep_method.ssvep_methd_base.CCABase

Class for Canonical Correlation Analysis (CCA) methods.

Inherits from SSVEPMethodBase and adds harmonic analysis capabilities.

n_harmonics#

Number of harmonics to consider for reference signals.

Type:

int

classifier(test_data)[source]#

Classifies test data using the trained TRCA model.

Parameters:

test_data (numpy.ndarray) – Test data of shape (n_trials, n_channels, n_times).

Returns:

Predicted labels for test data.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

filter_bank(X)[source]#

Applies a filter bank to the input EEG signals.

Parameters:

X (numpy.ndarray) – Input EEG signals of shape (n_trials, n_channels, n_points).

Returns:

Filtered EEG signals of shape (n_fb, n_trials, n_channels, n_points).

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

get_w(train_data, train_label)[source]#

Computes the weight matrix for the TRCA method.

Parameters:

  • train_data (numpy.ndarray) – Training data of shape (n_trials, n_channels, n_times).

  • train_label (numpy.ndarray) – Labels for training data of shape (n_trials,).

Returns:

Weight matrix W of shape (n_events, n_channels). numpy.ndarray: Temporary matrix temp_X of shape (n_events, n_channels).

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

train(train_data, train_label)[source]#

Trains the TRCA model using the provided training data and labels.

Parameters:

  • train_data (numpy.ndarray) – Training data of shape (n_trials, n_channels, n_times).

  • train_label (numpy.ndarray) – Labels for training data of shape (n_trials,).

Returns:

Weight matrix w_all of shape (n_filters, n_channels). numpy.ndarray: Temporary matrix temp_x_all of shape (n_filters, n_trials).

Return type:

numpy.ndarray
